intro: Crotalaria hirsuta, commonly known as hairy crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features yellow flowers with distinctive spurred petals. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to thrive in warm, dry environments. Crotalaria hirsuta is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
